You are my wife. Since you have had the right faith in me, have been waiting for me, have been helping me in every way, have been looking after my welfare, and have been doing my service, I, out of my natural affection for you and considering love as the reward, have decided to give you some fixed income, with my own money, all that I have acquired from my ancestors, all that I have built, and all that I have enjoyed my full right of possession up to this day, as set out in the third paragraph of the schedule below, worth Rs. 4,90,000/- in letters, R.C.C. Daba, with all the rights that I have, my family house with land, free from feudal encumbrances, considering love as the reward, and by virtue of this settlement deed, I hereby register it in your name and take possession of it immediately. Moreover, as of today, you are the absolute rightful owner of the entire property, and your son, grandson, and descendants shall enjoy eternal happiness with the rights of gift, sale, and inheritance. I will never have any disputes with you or your heirs regarding this. This property does not belong to the government or government institutions. I have never given any rights to such institutions. This property is not a signed property as per the Ordinance No. 2 of 9/77 of the Government of Andhra Pradesh. I hereby write and give this settlement deed in your name, believing that there is no other mortgage or other encumbrance on this property and that in case of any future disturbance or dispute, all such disputes shall be settled on my own responsibility and with the help of other assets in my possession and I shall be able to execute and issue this settlement deed in your name without any hindrance. 558 Jan

Certificate
Sri Vaddadi Ramu, father of Narasaiah, resident of Nimmalavalasa village, Cheepurupalli mandal, Vizianagaram district, has applied to this office to survey the area and boundaries of the said house and issue a certificate in the assessment no.2 of Cheepurupalli village village revenue limits.
In this regard, the current survey number of the terrace house shown by the applicant for obtaining Nimmalavalasa FMB is 47 p and the classification of the house is 54 feet long and 12 feet wide. It is also noted that the east of the house is bounded by the house of Sanyasamma Gari. West: Vaddadi Apparao Gari's foundation, North: Vaddadi Paidiraju's house, South: Canal boundaries. The report of the Mandal Surveyor, Cheepurupalli, Mandal Revenue Inspectors, Cheepurupalli, Village Revenue Officer and Village Surveyor Nimmalavalasa village has been verified. It is hereby notified. 'Only the survey number on the land is to be noted and notified in relation to the above land. No ownership rights or court transactions in relation to the above land are to be made. Ayyayi.

encumbranceDetails.description: VILL/COL: NIMMALAVALAS A/NIMMALAVALASA (0-0) W- B: 0-0 SURVEY: 47P HOUSE: 1-2 EXTENT: 72SQ.Yds BUILT: 312SQ. FT Boundires: [N]: HO USE OF VADDADI PYDIRAJU [S] CANAL [E]: HOUSE OF DA NNANA SANYASAMMA [W]: FOUNDATION OF VADDADI APPARAO

reportJson.assessmentNo: 2 ( As Per Deed & HTR )  212467000002 New Assessment number as per HTR

boundaries.scheduleNo: Boundaries As Per technical team observation

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 438 of 2026, dated 29/Jan/2026, executed by Vaddadi Ramu in favour of his Wife, Vaddadi Seethamma towards the property admeasuring an extent of 72 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-2 and Assessment Number 2, current meter number 124136CH21000250, comprised in survey number 47p, situated in Nimmalavalasa Revenue Village, Nimmalavalasa Panchayathi, Cheepurupalle Mandal, within the District of Vizianagaram, registered at sub-registrar office Chipurupalli, is bounded as follows: Boundaries as per Deed North by: House of Vaddadi Pydiraju South by: Canal East by: House of Dannnana Sanyasamma West by: Foundation of Vaddadi Apparao Boundaries as per Actual North by: House of Vaddadi Pydiraju South by: Passage, Drainage and CC Road East by: House of Dannnana Sanyasamma West by: Foundation of Vaddadi Apparao

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 47p, bearing house no.1-2 and Assessment Number 2, situated in Nimmalavalasa measuring about 72 Sq. Yds., was originally owned by Vaddadi Ramu, who acquired the Property from the father’s lineage. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned Vaddadi Ramu executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 29/Jan/2026, registered as document No. 438 of 2026, before the SRO Chipurupalli, in favour of his Wife, Vaddadi Seethamma towards the property measuring 72 Sq. Yds., bearing house no. 1-2 and Assessment Number 2, comprised in survey no. 47p, at Nimmalavalasa. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : 1. The Property Tax Receipt No. TAX18102025082626412, dated 18/Oct/2025, imprinted by the Nimmalavalasa Grama Panchayath discloses that Vaddadi Ramu has paid property tax for the period 2024-2026, towards house number 1-2. 2. Encumbrance Certificate vide Statement No. 139929432, dated 30/Jan/2026 extracted with respect to the Schedule Property does not reflect any adverse entries. 3. Internal Approval Provided By the F.I for the Mismatch of South Boundary Between Deed (Canal) and Actual (Passage, Drainage and CC Road) and from the actual south boundary it is confirmed that their is passage of way towards the schedule property, Hence it is advisable to F.I to verify the same and proceed as per Internal Policy
The HTR attached discloses that Vaddadi Ramu is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Vaddadi Seethamma.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I policy and have concluded that the Vaddadi Seethamma, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property admeasuring an extent of 72 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 1-2 and Assessment Number 2, current meter number 124136CH21000250, comprised in survey number 47p, situated in Nimmalavalasa Revenue Village, Nimmalavalasa Panchayathi, Cheepurupalle Mandal, within the District of Vizianagaram, registered at sub-registrar office Chipurupalli.

Further, the current owner,  Vaddadi Seethamma is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant  Vaddadi Ramu.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
